text: joy and disbelief after two and a half
years they're free at last
daughters reunited with their parents it
was a time for celebration
but also reflection we're so excited we
never thought this day would come
these girls were among the 276 students
abducted by their Islamist group Boko
Haram speaking at an event to mark the
release one girl describes the horrors
they endured I never thought I would see
you again there was a day when a bomb
dropped by jets explode close to where I
was it's only by God's grace we survived
for 40 days without food but yet we are
here the parents wanted their daughters
to get an education but it was a choice
they thought had cost them their
children yarmulke Haruna gia I said to
her you really alive and she replied yes
yeah we both burst into tears what did
she tell you about her time in captivity
for not watching the financial they were
told the appearance we're no longer
alive that they had been killed all they
did was cry they never imagined that
they would see us again
officials say negotiations are
continuing but dozens of students
reportedly don't want to come home after
marrying fighters
for now these girls are celebrating
their freedom but recovering from their
kidnapping won't be easy especially when
most of their schoolmates are still
being held
Martin patience BBC News Abuja
